alert.note: Alert for Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 31 at 5:57PM MST until July 31 at 9:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Navajo County in north central Arizona... * Until 900 PM MST /1000 PM MDT/. * At 556 PM MST /656 PM MDT/, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain from Tsegi to Kayenta. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Tsegi, Kayenta, Navajo National Monument. This includes the following highways... Highway 160 between mile markers 368 and 404. Highway 163 between mile markers 394 and 408. State Route 564 between mile markers 375 and 383. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Moenkopi Wash, Tsegi Canyon, Dinnebito Wash, Capitan Wash, El, Shonto Wash, Tyende Creek, Laguna Creek, Cutfoot Wash, Parrish Creek and Narrow Canyon Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
